Detailed Description

Object for controlling the DAZ Studio progress dialog.

DzProgress provides a thread-safe interface for using the DAZ Studio Application progress dialog. Simply create an instance to start displaying progress, when you call finish() or the DzProgress instance is destroyed, it will stop displaying progress. Multiple DzProgress instances may be active at the same time. As long as one DzProgress instance is active, the progress dialog will be shown to the user.

Example:
    void MyClass::doSomething() 
    {
        // Create a DzProgress object and start a progress operation.
        DzProgress  myProgress( "Doing Something...", 100 );

        for( int i = 0; i < 100; i++ ){
            ...do something...
            // Step progress
            myProgress.step();
        }

        // Tell the progress bar you are finished.
        // This call is only needed if you want to finish the progress before leaving scope
        myProgress.finish();
    }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzProgress::DzProgress ( const QString &  info,
int  totalSteps = 0,
bool  isCancellable = false,
bool  showTimeElapsed = false 
)

Constructs a DzProgress and begins a progress operation, showing the progress dialog if it is not already visible. It is safe to construct DzProgress from non-GUI threads.

Parameters:
info The message that is displayed in the progress dialog.
totalSteps The total number of steps for the progress operation. If 0, the progress dialog and info message is displayed, but the progress bar is not shown until a DzProgress instance with non-zero total steps is created. Pass in -1 to create an indeterminate progress indicator which will continue rolling until finish() is called.
isCancellable If true, the 'Cancel' button will be displayed on the progress dialog.
showTimeElapsed If true, the progress dialog will display the total time elapsed since the progress operation started.
DzProgress::~DzProgress (  )  [virtual]

Destructor - ends the progress operation if finish() has not already been called.

Member Function Documentation

void DzProgress::cancel (  )  [virtual]

Cancels the current operation. If the current operation can not be cancelled, this has no effect. This function is Thread-Safe.

Implements IDzProgress.

void DzProgress::enable ( bool  onOff = true  )  [static]

Sets whether or not the progress dialog is enabled. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the progress dialog will be shown normally for progress operations. If false, the progress dialog will not be shown when new DzProgress instances are created.
void DzProgress::finish (  )  [virtual]

Ends the current progress operation, if no other progress operations are active, the progress dialog is automatically closed. It is not necessary to explicitly call this function - the progress operation will be ended when the DzProgress instance is destroyed. However, it may sometimes be desirable to end a progress operation before the instance is destroyed, so this function is provided for those cases.

Note:
This function is re-entrant, but not thread-safe. It should be called from the same thread that created the operation.

Implements IDzProgress.

QWidget * DzProgress::getAdditionalInfoWidget (  )  const

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
The current additional information widget for the progress dialog or NULL if none.
bool DzProgress::isActive (  )  [static]

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the progress dialog is currently being shown, false if no progress operations are currently active.
bool DzProgress::isCancelled (  )  const [virtual]

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the progress operation has been cancelled, otherwise false. If the progress operation can not be cancelled, this will always be false.

Implements IDzProgress.

bool DzProgress::isCloseOnFinish (  )  const

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the progress dialog will be closed automatically when the operation is finished, false if it will stay open until the user closes it.
bool DzProgress::isEnabled (  )  [static]

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the progress dialog is enabled, false if the progress dialog will not be shown for progress operations.
bool DzProgress::isShowingCloseCheckbox (  )  const

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the 'Close on finish' check-box is being shown on the progress dialog, otherwise false.
bool DzProgress::isShowingTimeElapsed (  )  const

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the progress dialog is displaying the time elapsed for the operation, otherwise false.
bool DzProgress::isShowingTimeEstimate (  )  const

This function is Thread-Safe.

Returns:
true if the progress dialog is displaying the estimated time remaining for the operation, otherwise false.
void DzProgress::pause (  )  [static]

'Pauses' the progress dialog by temporarily hiding it, allowing the user to interact with other dialogs. Must be paired with a call to resume(). This function is Thread-Safe.

void DzProgress::resume (  )  [static]

'Resumes' the progress dialog after a call to pause() displaying the progress dialog again normally. Has no effect if pause() was not called. This function is Thread-Safe.

void DzProgress::setAdditionalInfoWidget ( QWidget *  wid  ) 

Adds an additional information widget to the progress dialog. The dialog can only have one additional widget at a time. The widget is destroyed when the operation ends, or when a new additional widget is specified. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
wid The widget to add to the progress dialog for this progress operation.
void DzProgress::setCloseOnFinish ( bool  closeOnFinish  ) 

Sets whether or not the progress dialog automatically closes when the progress operation is finished. This only has effect when the 'Close when finished' check-box is visible. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
closeOnFinish If true, the progress dialog will automatically close when the operation is finished. If false, the progress dialog will remain open until the user closes it.
void DzProgress::setCurrentInfo ( const QString &  info  )  [static]

Sets the message displayed for the currently active progress operation. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
info The message to display on the progress dialog.
void DzProgress::setInfo ( const QString &  info  )  [virtual]

Sets the message displayed for this progress operation. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
info The message to display on the progress dialog.

Implements IDzProgress.

void DzProgress::setShowTimeElapsed ( bool  showElapsed  ) 

Sets whether or not the elapsed time for the operation is displayed on the progress dialog. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
showElapsed If true, the elapsed time will be displayed on the progress dialog, otherwise, the time will not be displayed.
void DzProgress::setShowTimeEstimate ( bool  showEstimate  ) 

Sets whether or not the estimated time remaining for the operation is displayed on the progress dialog. The remaining time will be calculated using the elapsed time and the ratio of current steps to remaining steps. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
showEstimate If true, the estimate of remaining time will be shown, otherwise, the estimate will not be displyed.
void DzProgress::setUseCloseCheckbox ( bool  showClose  ) 

Sets whether or not the 'Close when finished' check-box is displayed on the progress dialog. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
showClose If true the check-box will be displayed, if false, the check-box will not be displayed and the dialog will always close when the progress operation is finished.
void DzProgress::step ( int  numSteps = 1  )  [virtual]

Steps the progress indicator. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
numSteps The number of steps to move the progress indicator.

Implements IDzProgress.

void DzProgress::update ( int  position  )  [virtual]

Updates the progress indicator to the given number of steps. This function is Thread-Safe.

Parameters:
position The number of steps to set the progress indicator position to.

Implements IDzProgress.
